questions.text: Most common benign tumor of Lung is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Hamartoma Benign tumors of the lung are uncommon and account for fewer than 15% of solitary lesions seen on chest radiographs. A peripheral tumor usually causes no symptoms until it is large; a central tumor may present with haemoptysis and signs of bronchial obstruction while still small. A tumor is likely to be benign if it has not increased in size on chest radiographs for more than 2 years or it has some degree of calcification; however, a tissue diagnosis is usually pursued. Most benign nodules are granulomas (tuberculosis or histoplasmosis). The most common benign tumor is a hamartoma , a developmental abnormality containing mesothelial and endothelial elements. Diagnosis (and definitive treatment) is achieved by excision of the lesion. Any of the mesodermal elements of the lung may form mesodermal tumors ( chondroma, lipoma, leiomyoma ). Deposits of amyloid may have a similar radiographic appearance to a nodule (pseudotumor).

Highyeild:

Pulmonary Hamartoma Pulmonary Hamartoma is the most common benign tumor of the lung , and it is characterized by overgrowth of cartilage . It typically occurs in males aged between 40-60 years and grows slowly in the lung, usually in the peripheral region . The diagnosis of this condition is usually made through a chest X-ray which shows a characteristic popcorn calcification or a CT scan which shows a coin lesion . The definitive treatment for pulmonary hamartoma is the surgical excision of the lesion.

It is a rare tumor of the lung and may cause symptoms such as cough and shortness of breath. The definitive treatment for chondroma is surgical resection. Option: C. Lipoma : A lipoma is a benign tumor composed of adipose tissue (fat). Lipomas are very rare in the lung and may be asymptomatic or cause symptoms such as cough and shortness of breath. The definitive treatment for lipoma is surgical resection. Option: D. Leiomyoma : A leiomyoma is a benign tumor composed of smooth muscle tissue. Leiomyomas are rare in the lung and may cause symptoms such as cough and shortness of breath. The definitive treatment for leiomyoma is surgical resection

Solution:

Small cell carcinoma Eaton-Lambert syndrome is most commonly associated with small cell carcinoma of the lung . This syndrome is caused by antibodies that develop against voltage-gated calcium channels on the neuromuscular junction , leading to muscle weakness and fatigue. Small cell carcinoma accounts for approximately 10-15% of all lung cancers and is often associated with other paraneoplastic syndromes, such as SIADH and Cushing's syndrome.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Adenocarcinoma : Adenocarcinoma is a type of non-small cell lung cancer that is not typically associated with Eaton-Lambert syndrome. Instead, adenocarcinoma is commonly associated with other paraneoplastic syndromes, such as hypertrophic osteoarthropathy and clubbing. Option: B. Squamous cell carcinoma : Squamous cell carcinoma is another type of non-small cell lung cancer that is not typically associated with Eaton-Lambert syndrome. Squamous cell carcinoma can be associated with other paraneoplastic syndromes, such as hypercalcemia and thrombocytosis.

questions.text: Which of the following is the most common presentation of lung cancer?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Persistent cough The most common presentation of lung cancer is persistent cough .

Highyeild:

The presentation of lung carcinoma is determined by various factors such as the location of the tumor, invasion of surrounding tissues, and the degree of metastasis. Typical indications of this condition may include a persistent cough, unexplained weight loss, difficulty breathing (dyspnea), and non-specific chest discomfort.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B, C. The other common symptoms include weight loss, dyspnoea, chest pain, haemoptysis and clubbing. Patients can have hoarseness of voice due to mediastinal involvement compressing the recurrent laryngeal nerve. Other presentations may be superior vena cava syndrome and Lambert Eaton syndrome.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is/are true about small cell lung cancer? It is the most aggressive subtype of lung cancer Surgical resection is the primary modality of management Mediastinal involvement is found in advanced cases Hypercalcemia is a known paraneoplastic syndrome Can cause superior vena cava syndrome Select the correct answer from given below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1,4,5 Statement 1. Small cell lung cancer is the most aggressive subtype of lung cancer Statement 2. Chemotherapy is the primary modality in its management Statement 3. It causes massive lymphadenopathy and early mediastinal involvement Statement 4, 5. It can cause hypercalcemia and SVC syndrome

Highyeild:

Small cell lung cancers are a type of neuroendocrine tumor. It represents about 20% of all lung cancers. They are known as oat cell cancers due to the packed nature of small dense cells. These tumors tend to metastasize early to lymph nodes and by blood-borne spread.

questions.text: Which of the following is not a correct statement of bronchoalveolar carcinoma of the lung?

options.label: A
options.text: Variant of Adenocarcinoma of the lung

options.label: B
options.text: Propensity to metastasise to opposite lung

questions.correct_answer: B. Propensity to metastasise to opposite lung
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Propensity to metastasise to opposite lung These tumors can also be found in the opposite lung, but these are regarded as multifocal primary tumors rather than metastatic disease.

Highyeild:

Bronchoalveolar cancer is a type of adenocarcinoma, which is the most common type of lung cancer. BAC is characterized by the growth of tumor cells along the alveolar septa, leading to the replacement of normal lung tissue by tumor tissue. BAC can be classified into two subtypes: mucinous and nonmucinous. Mucinous BAC is associated with a poorer prognosis. BAC is typically diagnosed through imaging tests such as CT scans, and confirmed through biopsy.

Extraedge:

Treatment options for BAC depend on the stage of the cancer and may include surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, and targeted therapy. BAC has a better prognosis than other types of lung cancer, but it can still be aggressive and difficult to treat, particularly if it has metastasized to other parts of the body.

questions.text: A 67 years old male patient presents to you with complaints of right upper eyelid ptosis, associated with enophthalmos. On examination of the eye, you also notice miosis. He is a known smoker with a history of 30 pack years of smoking. His chest CT reveals a 4 x 4 cm tumor and is shown to you. What is the T stage of this tumor?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

T3 A 67 years old male patient presenting with ptosis , enophthalmos and miosis points towards a diagnosis of Horner’s syndrome . The chest CT reveals a superior sulcus tumor in the right lung. Superior sulcus tumors are staged as T3 irrespective of their size. T3 is a tumor > 5 cm but ≤ 7 cm in greatest dimension or directly invading any of the following: parietal pleura (PL3), chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors ), phrenic nerve, parietal pericardium; or separate tumor nodule(s) in the same lobe as the primary.

questions.text: Bronchoplastic lung resection is used for which type of lung tumor?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Carcinoid tumor Bronchoplastic or sleeve lung resections involve removing a central tumor that is invading a major bronchus, such as the left or right main bronchus, together with the lobe of the lung involved, with re-anastomosis of the cut major bronchus to the remaining lobar bronchus. It is useful in dealing with tumors such as carcinoids that, despite having a low- grade potential, are often found in a major bronchus.

Highyeild:

Preservation of lung tissue is being considered due to complications and high mortality of pneumonectomy. Surgical resection margins cannot be compromised in this approach. Sleeve lung resections are used to remove a central tumor that invades a major bronchus. Lobe of the lung involved is also removed, and the remaining lobar bronchus is anastomosed to the cut major bronchus.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Options: A, B . For squamous cell cancer and adenocarcinoma of the lung, wide surgical excision is the treatment modality of choice, which may be in the form of segmentectomy, lobectomy or pneumonectomy along with hilar and mediastinal lymphadenectomy Option: C. For small cell lung cancer, chemotherapy is the treatment modality of choice.

questions.text: Consider the following statements with respect to management of lung cancer. Gefitinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor used as targeted therapy for small cell lung cancer Cisplatin with paclitaxel is the chemotherapy of choice for lung cancer Curative surgical resection is contraindicated in cases with tracheal involvement T3N1 tumor can be managed by surgery alone Persistent air leak is the most common complication of surgery Mark the correct option with respect to true/false:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1-F, 2-T, 3-T, 4-T, 5-F Statement 1. Gefitinib is a tyrosine kinase inhibitor used as a targeted therapy for non- small cell lung cancer, especially adenocarcinoma of the lung Statement 2. Cisplatin/carboplatin with paclitaxel/etoposide is the chemotherapy of choice for lung cancers Statement 3. Surgical resection is contraindicated in cases where there is invasion of central mediastinal structures such as the heart, great vessels, trachea and esophagus. Statement 4. Tumors with stage up to T3 and N1 can be managed by surgical resection alone. Statement 5. Bleeding is the most common complication of surgery.

Highyeild:

Determining operable tumors requires careful investigation. The TNM staging system provides prognostic information. Tumors graded up to T3, N1, M0 have improved prognosis when treated surgically. Accurate staging is necessary before resection. For higher stage tumors , a multi- or trimodality approach is offered. Non-tumor factors determine appropriate treatment. Incurable disease is treated palliatively to maximize quality of life.

questions.text: Consider the following statements regarding mediastinal masses. Most common mediastinal mass is thymoma Most common middle mediastinal mass is lymphoma Most common anterior mediastinal mass is lymphoma Most common posterior mediastinal mass is neurogenic tumor Most common site of lymphoma is middle mediastinum. Which of the following statements are false?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2,3,5 Statement 1. Most common mediastinal mass is a thymoma , found in the anterior mediastinum Statement 2. Most common middle mediastinal mass is a pericardial cyst Statement 3. Most common anterior mediastinal mass is a thymoma while anterior mediastinum is the most common site of a lymphoma Statement 4. Most common posterior mediastinal mass is a neurogenic tumor Statement 5. Most common site of lymphoma is anterior mediastinum

Highyeild:

Thymoma is the most common anterior mediastinal mass. Cysts, including pericardial cysts, are the most common middle mediastinal masses. Neurogenic tumors are the most common posterior mediastinal masses. Lymphoma, bronchogenic cysts, and mesenchymal tumors can be found in all three compartments of the mediastinum.

Extraedge:

CT is the diagnostic test of choice for most mediastinal masses except neurogenic tumors. MRI is the diagnostic test of choice for neurogenic tumors. questions.correct_answer: B. Myasthenia gravis responds to thymectomy only when the gland has a thymoma
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Myasthenia gravis responds to thymectomy only when the gland has a thymoma Myasthenia gravis may respond to excision of the thymus gland even when the gland has no associated thymoma present.

Highyeild:

Thymoma is a common mediastinal tumor derived from the thymus gland. Thymomas can range from benign to aggressively invasive. They are often associated with myasthenia gravis. Capsular invasion is the only reliable indicator of malignancy. Complete thymectomy is the best way to diagnose and treat thymoma. CT scan of the chest revealing a large necrotic mass in the left anterior mediastinum ( thymoma ) and bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option: A. Thymomas are often related to myasthenia gravis, a neuromuscular condition. Option: C. Diagnosis and treatment are best achieved by complete thymectomy , which is usually performed as a median sternotomy. Option: D. Stage IVA Masaoka staging system is pleural or pericardial dissemination .

Extraedge:

For large tumors or suspected tumor invasion, median sternotomy is performed. Less invasive approaches can be considered for small tumors or when thymus is being excised as a treatment, including VATS approach or transcervical approach.
